page.title: 12Education in Marldon
page.content: When they are 5, children can go to our village school near the bungalows which have been built in the past 20 years. The "old" school, near the church was there for 100 years. but got too small. The "new" school has been up for 18 years and has 4 classes and a hall. In the gales of 1978 the hall windows blew in. The Governors rebuilt the whole of the front, putting in a Library and a staff room.The Governors and teachers worked every Sunday for nearly a year, helped by prisoners from Cannings Wood jail. The Parents Association raises money by fetes and sponsored walks. The P.T.A. has built a heated outdoor learner pool and provided lots of luxuries and books for the school. After Marldon, most of our children go to Totnes Comprehensive School by bus.
